Generation IV.Diamond: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees F from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.
Generation IV.Pearl: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees F from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.
Generation IV.Platinum: When launching 3,600 degrees F fireballs, its body takes on a whitish hue from the intense heat.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. Its breath also sears and sizzles.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. Its breath also sears and sizzles.

Generation V.Black: When launching 3,600 degrees F fireballs, its body takes on a whitish hue from the intense heat.
Generation V.White: When launching 3,600 degrees F fireballs, its body takes on a whitish hue from the intense heat.
Generation V.Black 2: When shooting 3,600 degrees F fireballs from its arms, its body takes on a whitish hue from the intense heat.
Generation V.White 2: When shooting 3,600 degrees F fireballs from its arms, its body takes on a whitish hue from the intense heat.

Generation VI.X: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.
Generation VI.Y: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. Its breath also sears and sizzles.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. Its breath also sears and sizzles.

Generation VII.Sun: They dwell in volcanic craters. According to what is known, a single pair of male and female Magmortar lives in one volcano.
Generation VII.Moon: From its arm, it launches fireballs hotter than 3,500 degrees Fahrenheit . Its arm starts to melt when it fires a whole barrage.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: There are still quite a few factories that rely on the flames provided by Magmortar to process metals.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Magmortar takes down its enemies by shooting fireballs, which burn them to a blackened crisp. It avoids this method when hunting prey.

Generation VIII.Sword: When Magmortar inhales deeply, the fire burning in its belly intensifies, rising in temperature to over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit .
Generation VIII.Shield: Living in the crater of a volcano has caused this Pokémon's body to resemble its environment—it has an organ similar to a magma chamber.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Use of a strange item caused this Pokémon to evolve. Fireballs launched from the ends of its tubelike arms are hot enough to melt an iron pot in an instant.

Generation IX.Scarlet: When shooting 3,600 degree Fahrenheit fireballs from its arms, its body takes on a whitish hue from the intense heat.
Generation IX.Violet: They dwell in volcanic craters. It’s said that only a single pair of Magmortar will inhabit any given volcano.
